notesStmt.note: Yosef ben Yudah Elhakhim: inscribed with his name in the colophon (see volume 3, Or 2628, folio 185v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The first volume of the three-volume Bible (aka 'the Lisbon Bible'), containing the Pentatuech with masorah magna, masorah parva and some masoretic notes; punctuated.

collation.p: 24 quires: i-ii8 (folios 1-8, 9-16), iii6(folios 17-22), iv-x8 (folios 23-78), xi6(folios 79-84), xii-xix8 (folios 85-148), xx6 (folios 149-154), xxi-xxiii8 (folios 155-178), xxiv6 (folios 179-184). Catchwords at the end of a quire. On guards.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script, punctuated. Shemu᾿el ben Shemu᾿el ibn Musa: inscribed with his name in the colophon, Lisbon, 5243 [1483] (see volume 3, Or 2628, folio 185v).

decoDesc.decoNote: 53 full borders, in colours and gold. Numerous decorated initial-word panels, in colours and gold. Numerous decorated parashah signs, in colours and gold. Masorah magna in micrographical design in the margins. Full-page micrographic design.
